A thin wrapper of dplyr::case_when() if there are NAs

A thin wrapper of dplyr::case_when() if there are NAs

case_na(formula)

Arguments

formula

A two-sided formula. The LHS expects a vector containing NA, and the RHS gives the replacement value.

See also

dplyr::case_when

Examples

x <- rnorm(10)
x[c(3, 7)] <- NA_real_
case_na(x ~ 10)
#>  [1] -0.2343379  2.0866886 10.0000000 -1.3928471 -1.1422908  1.7046087
#>  [7] 10.0000000 -0.4372812 -0.1192151  0.7864629
case_na(x ~ mean(x, na.rm = TRUE))
#>  [1] -0.2343379  2.0866886  0.1564735 -1.3928471 -1.1422908  1.7046087
#>  [7]  0.1564735 -0.4372812 -0.1192151  0.7864629
